SS. Dear SS: According to Foodsafety.gov, uncooked poultry is safe in the refrigerator for 1-2 days, and safe in the freezer for 9 months (for pieces) and up to 12 months for whole chickens or turkey. Cooked poultry is safe refrigerated for 3-4 days.

AnswerThis meat will last about the same as all cooked meats. If it is stored in an airtight container. It will last about 5 days. According to the Idaho Heath Department, meat and lettuce stay good for a MAXIMUM of 7 days from opening the package. The date on the package tells you information about how long you can wait before you need to open the product and start using.

Cooked Chicken. You can keep cooked chicken in the refrigerator for up to four days. Wrap the cooked chicken in plastic wrap or place it in an airtight container. Put it in the refrigerator as quickly as possible after it cools to room temperature.
